recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Moong Daal also known as Pesarapappu in Andhra is a simple daal served with white rice.

Dal is god source of dietary fiber, protein and low in sodium and cholestrol. Studies have also shown that consuming pulses can result in more stable blood glucose levels after meals due to its lower glycemic index.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Wash lentils thoroughly with water until water runs clear. Soak it for 15mins (soak it for more time if you want to save time while cooking.Add turmeric, garlic, green chillies to the lentil and cook it over medium flame for 10 mins.
Add onions and tomatoes. Let the lentils cook until tomatoes and lentils are soft, say about 15 mins. Add water if you don’t want lentils to be more thick.
Once cooked, add salt as per requirement. Keep it aside.

For seasoning, heat oil in a pan. Add mustard and cumin seeds and allow it to splutter. Add curry leaves, red chili. Sauté for 5 secs. Be careful at this step as curry leaves splutter oil in all directions. Switch of the stove and add the seasoning to cooked lentils.
Moong daal has a tendency to soak water if kept it for a long time. So it is always good to add more water if to be consumed after a couple of hours.

tips.tipDesc: To save time, pressure cook lentils with all ingredients till 1 whistle followed by seasoning. However, the taste will differ.
